intro: Dortmanna dentata, commonly known as the toothed dock, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped, toothed leaves that are often hairy. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late summer. Dortmanna dentata is typically found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
